page.title: 04A House Boat
page.content: I live on an M.T.B. which stands for motor torpedo boat which was used in the war and was once blown up but repaired. We have nine rooms and what is the lounge now, used to be an engine room. At one end of the boat it was air tight so if it sank all the men would go up that end and they would be safe. I live on the boat with my mum, dad, brother, cat and goldfish. The boat is 72 feet long and about 16 feet wide. Out-side we have a rowing boat, raft, and a diving board, the boat is moored on the saltings. At high tide the gang- plank is very steep and it is hard to get up and down, if the tide is high and it sometimes comes over the path from the carpark to the boat.
